Author: Seko#7408
Content: In which language are games programmed on the blockchain?  Potentially also in HTML5?  I run HTML5 Games websites and I'm looking for a bridge to the blockchain.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
Existing demonstrations are coded in C/C++ lanaguage, it's Crypto-Conditions code which is coded in C/C++.
So, it's not specifically what langauge is used for game(s).
Mix of languages is possible to code a crypto-conditions code, but it has to compile be linked as a library to komodo code.
An interpreter can be built for this, which I'm not sure how long it might take. In my opinion, the first thing needs is to sort and make libraries for crypto-conditions in other languages, including WASM and such.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: but since you talk about games for web, it is possible to create a game engine, and let other languages use that to build games using it, including HTML5 games.

Author: fredrik#2289
Content: Great. Do you think there is a performance loss using interpreters builds. I‚Äôm using PHP a lot and do mainly text based games. No graphical stuff as per se.
